title: 106_hr3246
content: The Act titled "Small Business Pension Accessibility Act of 1999" reduces PBGC premium for new plans of small employers. The Small Business Pension Accessibility Act of 1999 amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act to reduce PBGC premiums for new single-employer plans maintained by small employers. The amendment includes a $5 fee per participant in such plans during the plan year. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to define a single-employer plan maintained by a contributing sponsor as a new plan for the first 5 years if no plan was previously established for the same employees. The term 'small employer' is defined as having 100 or fewer employees. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to define a single-employer plan maintained by a contributing sponsor as a new plan for the first 5 years if no plan was previously established for the same employees. The term 'small employer' is defined as having 100 or fewer employees. The amendments made by this section shall apply to plans established after December 31, 2000. SEC. 3. REDUCTION OF ADDITIONAL PBGC PREMIUM FOR NEW AND SMALL PLANS. New Plans.--Subparagraph (E) of section 4006(a)(3) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new clause for new defined benefit plans. The applicable percentage for the first five plan years is 0%, 20%, 40%, 60%, and 80% respectively. A defined benefit plan maintained by a contributing sponsor is considered new for its first 5 plan years. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new clause for new defined benefit plans. For small plans with 25 or fewer employees, the additional premium for each participant shall not exceed $5. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new clause for new defined benefit plans. The additional premium for each participant in small plans with 25 or fewer employees shall not exceed $5 multiplied by the number of participants in the plan. Effective dates for the amendments are specified for plans established after December 31, 2000, and plan years beginning after December 31, 2000.
